summary: The Stop Secret Spending Act of 2025 amends the Federal Funding Accountability and Transparency Act of 2006. It mandates the reporting of other transaction agreements (OTAs) to USAspending.gov, ensuring data is automatically transmitted and readily available. The bill requires annual reports on unreported federal spending and mandates an implementation plan. It also modifies requirements for Inspector General reports and establishes standards for data quality and display of federal spending information, aiming to improve transparency and accountability in government spending.
